methodology.title: How do we calculate these percentages?
methodology.intro: The percentages represent the probability of ideal weather conditions based on NASA historical data. For each date, we analyze:

recent10Years.title: Last 10 Years Data ({{years}} years)
recent10Years.description: We analyzed data from {{startYear}} to 2024 to identify recent climate trends. Of the {{totalYears}} years analyzed, {{idealYears}} had ideal conditions, resulting in {{probability}}% probability.

fullHistory.title: Complete Historical Data ({{years}} years)
fullHistory.description: For a broader view, we include data from up to 20 years ago. Of the {{totalYears}} years with available data, {{idealYears}} presented ideal conditions, generating {{probability}}% probability.

whyTwo.title: Why two percentages?
whyTwo.description: We present both metrics so you can make an informed decision:
whyTwo.recent: Last 10 years: Reflects more recent climate trends
whyTwo.full: Complete 20 years: Offers a broader historical perspective
